hierarchy.entry_subdomain: Information Exposure Through Access Control Failures

active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the risks of enabling directory listing in different environments (development vs. production) and debate whether it should ever be enabled, even for convenience. Support arguments with references from OWASP Security Misconfiguration guidelines and NIST SP 800-44 on securing web servers, addressing common misconceptions.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Pair students: One student explains the root cause of directory listing and demonstrates disabling it on Apache or Nginx using local tools (e.g., XAMPP or Docker). The partner teaches back using a non-example (secure configuration) and verifies with curl. Switch roles to reinforce application and address configuration misconceptions.
active_learning.problem_solving: Using a provided vulnerable web server (e.g., Docker image with enabled directory listing), scan for exposed directories, identify sensitive files (e.g., backups, configs), propose remediation steps (config changes for Apache/Nginx/IIS), implement the fix, and test verification (e.g., curl http://server/dir/ returns 403 or index file).
